title.rendered: A New Historical Novel Dream of Courage

content.rendered:
Robert and John Rushworth in The Nags Head, The Shambles Leeds 1740

Ursula Arlington, weaving a tapestry of suspense, intrigue

Robert Rushworth

November 22, 2023 Shawline Publishing, is thrilled to announce the launch of Paul Rushworth-Brown’s latest masterpiece, “Dream of Courage: Facing Fear Head On.”

Another great work by a very talented author who loves his period works and characters from great plots. He writes with verve and intent to deliver the imagination something unexpected! Brilliant!”

— Gavin, Readalot Magazine reviewer

MELBOURNE, VICTORIA, AUSTRALIA, November 5, 2023 /EINPresswire.com/ — Set against the backdrop of 18th-century England, this enthralling novel takes readers on an immersive journey into a world of secrets, intrigue, and unexpected bravery.

“The description of the landscape—ghost-like mist, grazing sheep, and fallow fields—paints a vivid picture of the environment, creating a backdrop that enhances the emotional weight of the characters’ interactions.”

“Dream of Courage: Facing Fear Head On” transports readers to a time when England was shrouded in mystery and darkness. The meticulously crafted historical immersion in 18th-century England offers a vivid and authentic portrayal of the era, allowing readers to truly step back in time. From the sprawling moors to the labyrinthine alleys of Leeds, the setting is mysterious and evocative, adding depth and allure to the riveting story.

“The great hall’s dim light and the fire’s crackling give a somber ambiance as the fate of the Rushworths hang in the balance. Jasper Calamy, a figure of power and privilege, plays a formidable game with the lives of those who depend on his grace’s benevolence. Tommy and Will, soaked from the rain, stood before him with their heads held high, masking their apprehension.”

“Throughout the chapter, the backdrop of rain and firelight served as a metaphor for the tumultuous times and the glimmers of hope that persisted. The characters’ resilience was illuminated by their interactions in this setting. Calamy’s satisfaction after securing the renegotiation and his cold dismissal of the Rushworths reflected the harsh reality of societal hierarchies.”

One of the key elements that sets “Dream of Courage” apart is its cast of compelling characters. Author of “Skulduggery” and “Red Winter Journey”, Paul Rushworth-Brown expertly introduces a diverse array of complex individuals, each with their own motivations and secrets. From the enigmatic tavern keeper Smythe to the swashbuckling pirate, Captain Girlington, the narrative is enriched by their presence, keeping readers on the edge of their seats as the plot unfolds.

“As the chapter concludes, the intricate tapestry of deceit and exploitation becomes more evident. The interplay between characters like Calamy, Griswold, and the Rushworths creates a compelling drama of power dynamics, moral quandaries, and the human spirit’s resilience. The reader is left eagerly anticipating the unfolding of these complexities, eager to understand how these relationships will evolve and how the character’s decisions will shape their destinies.”

“The story takes an intimate look into the lives and secrets of the characters, deepening the emotional resonance and intrigue. The narrative shifts to the perspective of Milton Killsin, revealing his inner turmoil and forbidden desires. This exploration of human complexities and suppressed emotions adds depth to the story, making it a captivating read.”

What truly makes “Dream of Courage” a literary triumph is its ability to resonate with readers on a deeply personal level. The Rushworth brothers, born into the desolation of the moors, are vividly portrayed as they navigate their way through ambition, danger, and redemption. Their dreams and aspirations mirror those of the reader, forging an emotional connection that will stay with them long after the final page is turned.

“The novel masterfully captures the tension between the characters’ desires, their societal roles, and their inner conflicts. The exploration of forbidden love, guilt, and the complexities of human emotions resonates with readers on a profound level. The meticulous attention to character development, emotional nuance, and the careful unfolding of the story’s layers creates a gripping narrative that promises a compelling and emotionally charged journey.”

“With its blend of emotional depth, vivid imagery, and the portrayal of universal human struggles, this chapter contributes to making the book a best-selling literary masterpiece that resonates with readers and keeps them engaged throughout the story.”

“Will’s return to his family’s cottage provides a heartwarming moment of connection between father and son. The exchange of the sixpence and corn symbolizes their unity and shared efforts to improve their family’s circumstances. This sense of unity contrasts with the hidden struggles of other characters, highlighting the complexity of relationships and the masks people wear.”

“We are excited to present ‘Dream of Courage: Facing Fear Head On’ to readers worldwide,” said Bradley Shaw, Managing Partner at Shawline Publishing. “With its richly detailed historical immersion, haunting setting, and compelling characters, this novel is a must-read for anyone seeking an unforgettable literary experience.”

“Dream of Courage: Facing Fear Head On” is available now at all major bookstores and online retailers. To learn more about the novel, please visit Shawline Publishing, Amazon.com or haworth/skulduggery/australia for interesting historical articles and other books.

Paul Brown
